Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PackageReference restore in Visual Studio should not spam the status bar" (#9915) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Today, when restoring in Visual Studio, when doing an actual restore or solution load restore, NuGet writes *a lot* of messages at the status bar. 

There's a bunch of messages such as "restore packages for" and "writing assets file for" which are pretty equivalent. 
In extreme cases this can lead up to 3-4 messages per projects, so you sometimes end up with 300 messages in a 15s restore. 

It's difficult to interpret all these messages, they are not very useful from a customer perspective. 

My suggestion is to reduce the number of messages, or potentially removing them completely. 

cc @JonDouglas 

Related to this, we considered https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9396, but it has bugs and is not suitable when *restore* is very quick.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add telemetry for NuGet's VS extensibility API faults" (#10062) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet's [VS extensibility APIs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/visual-studio-extensibility/nuget-api-in-visual-studio) usually should not throw exceptions. Currently, we have no visibility when they do throw, and require customers to report problems to us.

This is particularly an issue for the new [brokered services](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Contracts/NuGetServices.cs), because all exceptions get deserialized as a single exception type, and the stack trace is lost, so customers are unable to report detailed failures to us.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enable dotnet.exe integration tests to run cross platform" (#10426) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Most of tests in Dotnet.Integration.Test project are configured to run in Windows. We need to me some adjustments to run those tests on all platforms dotnet.exe supports: Windows, Mac, Linux.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pack includes content brought in through dependency packages into the current project's package (SDK based projects only)" (#8867) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS 2019 

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): 3.0.100

VS version (if appropriate): 16.3.8

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Windows 10.0.14393 x64

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: -

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

I have been using the `PrivateAssets="all"` option for a long time. It works great for `PackageReference`. Now I needed to use some content file in my project and I could not achieve the desired behavior with `PrivateAssets="all"`. I want to build "base" package with one file `data.json` which should be consumed in "top" package but should not be exposed further to consumers of the "top" package.

My "base" package:
```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>netstandard2.0</TargetFramework>
    <IncludeBuildOutput>false</IncludeBuildOutput>
    <GeneratePackageOnBuild>true</GeneratePackageOnBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Content Include="data.json">
      <PackagePath>contentFiles/any/any/data.json</PackagePath>
    </Content>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```
The result seems to be good for me:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21261007/69996708-a573d980-1563-11ea-8069-bb275803e1fb.png)

My "top" package:
```xml
<Project>
  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="BasePackage" Version="1.0.0">
      <PrivateAssets>all</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

The Result is unexpected for me:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21261007/69997235-bc66fb80-1564-11ea-8c80-23e46bfa7cdb.png)

Why is the file again in the content section? This file is a development dependency, some sort of settings file. The "base" package is a package with Roslyn analyzers and the settings file - `data.json`. I do not present the analyzers used for clarity. For them, `PrivateAssets` works as it should - they do not fall into the dependencies of the "base" package. But for the settings file - `data.json`, I can‚Äôt get the same behavior.

I spent a lot of time resolving this issue and it seems to me that I do not see any obvious solution, which is somewhere nearby. I will be very grateful for the advice.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Enable dotnet.exe integration tests to run cross platform" (#10426) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Most of tests in Dotnet.Integration.Test project are configured to run in Windows. We need to me some adjustments to run those tests on all platforms dotnet.exe supports: Windows, Mac, Linux.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NVDA/Narrator is not reading "License" label for "Apache-2.0" link" (#10425) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1240645
Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier
Environment Details:‚Äã
Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Preview
Version 16.8 Preview 6.0
OS Details:
Windows 10 Enterprise

Version : 20H2

Build: 19042.572

Re-pro Steps:‚Äã
Start Narrator/NVDA andOpen Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Preview (Version 16.8.0 Preview 6.0)
Create a new "Grpc" project
Tab till ‚ÄúSolution Explorer‚Äù and open "Context Menu".
Navigate to "Manage Nuget Packages for Solution" and press enter on it.
Navigate to "Update"  tab using arrow key.
Search for "gRPC" packages.
Tab to "Apache - 2.0" link present in description section and verify NVDA/Narrator is reading the corresponding label "License".
Actual Result:‚Äã
NVDA/Narrator is not reading "License" label for "Apache-2.0" link

Expected Result:‚Äã
NVDA/Narrator should read information that "Apache - 2.0" link is related to License.

User Impact:‚Äã
Screen Reader will not get the completing information about controls if screen reader is not reading the labels.

MAS Reference:‚Äã
MAS 1.3.1 -- Info and Relationships

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NU1004 when restoring a solution that has mixed Legacy and netstandard2 projects from cmd line with LockedMode" (#9623) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem


NuGet product used: nuget.client

NuGet version Several, but exists in prod 5.4, 5.5, 5.5.1 and 5.6 as well as 5.7 preview 1

VS version: 2019 16.7 Preview 1

OS version: Windows 10 19635.1

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a new dotnet core library (default is fine)
2. Add anew .net 4.7.2 library (with packages.config but also fails with PackageReference)
3. Add some legacy framework librarys to th e.net 4.7.2 library (i chose Google.Apis)
4. Add a project reference from .net core library to legacy framework library (no actual code reference needed)
5. install nuget.exe (i used chocolatey, installed prod 5.6.0)
6. open a command prompt, navigate to your solution foldeer
7. type "nuget.exe restore <your project>.sln -UseLockFile" (succeeds)
8. type "nuget.exe restore <your project>.sln -LockedMode (fails, with NU1004) (also fails if both flags are combined)

NOTE: Some observations
- Project builds fine in VS without error. 
- multi-targeting netstandard2 and net472 produces the same failed results.
- the generated packages.lock.json file looks reasonably correct to me.

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

```
C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1>nuget restore ClassLibrary1.sln -LockedMode -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.4.0.6315
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.7.0.22806' from 'C:\PROGRA~2\MICROS~1\2019\Preview\MSBuild\Current\Bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
MSBuild P2P timeout [ms]: 120000
C:\PROGRA~2\MICROS~1\2019\Preview\MSBuild\Current\Bin\msbuild.exe "C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\aegggkrs.jgg.nugetinputs.targets" /t:GenerateRestoreGraphFile /nologo /nr:false /v:q /p:NuGetRestoreTargets="C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\pirmklvn.dnv.nugetrestore.targets" /p:RestoreUseCustomAfterTargets="True" /p:RestoreTaskAssemblyFile="C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\lib\NuGet.CommandLine\tools\nuget.exe" /p:RestoreSolutionDirectory="C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\\" /p:SolutionDir="C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\\" /p:SolutionName="ClassLibrary1" /p:RestoreLockedMode="True"

All packages listed in packages.config are already installed.
Running restore with 16 concurrent jobs.
Reading project file C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1.csproj.
The restore inputs for 'ClassLibrary1' have changed. Continuing restore.
Persisting no-op dg to C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\obj\ClassLibrary1.csproj.nuget.dgspec.json
NU1004: The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Disable the RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass an explicit --force-evaluate option to run restore to update the lock file.
Committing restore...
Assets file has not changed. Skipping assets file writing. Path: C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\obj\project.assets.json
Writing cache file to disk. Path: C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\obj\ClassLibrary1.csproj.nuget.cache
Writing packages lock file at disk. Path: C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\packages.lock.json
Restore failed in 83.46 ms for C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\source\repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1.csproj.

NuGet Config files used:
    C:\Users\ErikFunkenbusch\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
    C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config
    C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Xamarin.Offline.config

Feeds used:
    C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\
    https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

```

### Sample Project

[ClassLibrary1.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/4699515/ClassLibrary1.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
